The highest possible hand that can be made from these two sets of cards is a straight, ace to five. The straight runs from 10 down to 2, and since we're using the ace-to-five ranking system, the highest card in the hand is the ace, which gives us an ace-high straight.

data.sampled:
The highest possible one-pair hand is:

Aces and Nines

The A♣9♣ in the hole is matched by the J♣9♠ on the board to make a pair of Nines. The K♣ in the hole is irrelevant since it doesn't match any of the cards on the board. Note that the hand is only ranked by the highest pair, so the J♣ and J♦ are both treated as the same card, J, for the purposes of evaluating the hand rank.

The highest possible hand that can be formed from the given cards is: "Queen-high straight".

The queen in the hole cards is the highest card, and the 9, 10, 6, 8, and 3 in the community cards make a straight from 6 to 10, which is a queen-high straight.

A straight flush, which is a hand consisting of 5 cards in numerical order, all of the same suit, would be a higher hand, but no such hand can be formed with the given cards.
